marytts.signalproc.sinusoidal
Class SinusoidalAnalyzer

java.lang.Object
  marytts.signalproc.sinusoidal.BaseSinusoidalAnalyzer
      marytts.signalproc.sinusoidal.SinusoidalAnalyzer
Direct Known Subclasses:
PitchSynchronousSinusoidalAnalyzer
public class SinusoidalAnalyzer
extends BaseSinusoidalAnalyzer

Sinusoidal Modeling Analysis Module Given a speech/audio signal, a set of amplitudes, frequencies and phases are estimated on a frame-by-frame basis Then, sinusoids that are close in frequency are grouped together to form sinusoidal tracks Optional amplitude and phase continuity constraints can be employed during track generation The implementation consists of ideas and algorithms from various papers as described in function headers References: Quatieri, T. F. Discrete-Time Speech Signal Processing: Principles and Practice. Prentice-Hall Inc. 2001. (Chapter 9 â€“ Sinusoidal Analysis/Synthesis) R.J. McAulay and T.F. Quatieri, "Speech Analysis/Synthesis Based on a Sinusoidal Representation," IEEE Transactions on Acoustics, Speech and Signal Processing, vol. ASSP-34, no. 4, August 1986.

Author:
Oytun Türk
